result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bradley M Guinther in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M states that the def will be entering a plea; parties ask Court to approve a DPA that includes restitution payoff within 60 days.

Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Court enters finding of guilty and questions DA as to why DPA is appropriate in this matter.  DA states that def is not a candidate for probation due to pending employment in Minnesota.  Atty. M concurs.  Def addresses the Court.  Court approves the DPA with admonishment to def.  DA notes that def remains on bond, with no drink condition, while DPA is in effect.
Status conference on November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bradley M Guinther in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA asks for brief setover.  Atty. M enters NG plea on def's behalf.  Court sets 11/30 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
